conclusion: Determine when objects A and B meet by finding time t where positions are equal.
Position is found by integrating velocity over time, using area under curve.
Graph shows velocity of objects A and B as a function of time.
Object A starts with velocity v0 and decreases over time.
Object B starts with zero velocity and increases over time.
Objects' velocities are equal and intersect after t1.
Approximate position by calculating area under each curve from t = 0 to intersection.
Position of object A from t = 0 to t1 is a trapezoid.
Position of object A from t1 to t2 is a trapezoid.
Position of object A from t2 to t3 is a triangle.
Position of object A from t3 to t4 is a rectangle.
Position of object B from t = 0 to t1 is a rectangle.
Position of object B from t1 to t2 is a rectangle.
Position of object B from t2 to t3 is a trapezoid.
Position of object B from t3 to t4 is a rectangle.
Calculate total areas under curves and find time t where areas are equal.
Objects meet around t = t3 as areas under curves are equal.
The two objects meet at t = t3.
